story_summary: Ivan is on the verge of a brain fever attack and experiences a hallucination of a gentleman who debates with him about existence, faith, and philosophy. The visitor, who represents a part of Ivan's own mind, engages in a lengthy conversation filled with anecdotes and reflections, while Ivan struggles to reject the hallucination. The chapter ends with Ivan hearing knocking at the window, which turns out to be his brother Alyosha bringing news that Smerdyakov has hanged himself.
evidence_quotes: he was at that moment on the very eve of an attack of brain fever
An hour ago Smerdyakov hanged himself,” Alyosha answered from the yard
